publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2266.1 Iain Smith: Private Finance Initiative—As an amendment to motion (S1M-2266) in the name of Tommy Sheridan, leave out from "and calls upon" to end and insert "; endorses the considered and balanced view taken by Matthew Taylor in his whole speech; welcomes the motion on private sector involvement in the public sector passed by the Liberal Democrat Conference following Mr Taylor’s speech, and in particular the seven key tests for the provision of public services: value for money, quality, democratic accountability and transparency, flexibility, fair treatment of employees including full consultation, development of the public service ethos and values and accessibility, and welcomes the changes made to the Private Finance Initiative/Public Private Partnership introduced by the Scottish Executive as a result of Partnership for Scotland: An Agreement for the First Scottish Parliament and the inquiry into PFI and PPP by the Finance Committee." Supported by: Mr Mike Rumbles*, Robert Brown*, Margaret Smith*
S1M-2266.1 Private Finance Initiative (lodged on 3 October 2001) Tavish Scott*, Nora Radcliffe*
S1M-2266.1 Private Finance Initiative (lodged on 3 October 2001) Ian Jenkins*
